Slide.title: Slide
Slide.description: Represents a single slide within a carousel.

content.description: The text content of the slide.

order.description: The order of the slide within the carousel.

definition.description: Stores carousels created by a user. Path-based ownership ensures only the user can access their carousels.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user who owns the carousel.

params.name: carouselId

definition.description: Stores slides belonging to a specific carousel. Path-based ownership ensures only the owning user can access these slides.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user who owns the carousel and slides.

params.name: carouselId
params.description: The ID of the carousel to which the slide belongs.

params.name: slideId
params.description: The unique ID of the slide.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to manage Instagram carousels generated by AI, focusing on user-owned data. Each user can create and manage their carousels and slides. Authorization Independence is achieved by storing carousels and slides as subcollections under each user's document (`/users/{userId}/carousels/{carouselId}` and `/users/{userId}/carousels/{carouselId}/slides/{slideId}`), granting the user full ownership and control without needing to check any other document. Path-based ownership provides strong security and avoids authorization dependencies on other documents. Slides are stored as a subcollection of carousels to maintain a clear hierarchical structure and enforce ownership. This also enables efficient querying for a user's carousels and their associated slides. This structure supports the application's QAPs because listing carousels or slides is always scoped to a specific user, preventing unauthorized access to other users' data. The `slideIds` array in the Carousel entity helps in maintaining the order of slides and can be used for efficient retrieval of slides for a given carousel.
